artifact.name: Dewing 1308
artifact.commentary: Evidently a brocage of the issue of 1301-7, although the reverse die is not the same as the obverse die. The explanation would seem to be that more than one obverse die was seated in the anvil, and that a coin struck from one lion in the anvil adhered to the punch die and struck a second flan which had been placed on a different lion. The obverse die appears to be that used for McClean 4063, whose reverse has two pellets, A and an uncertain symbol.

artifact.name: Dewing 1951
artifact.commentary: The attribution of this issue to Andros is conjectural. It is given to Athens by Seltman, Athens, its History and Coinage (Cambridge, 1924), p. 151-52 and Cahn, "Zur frühattischen Munzprägung," Museum Helveticum 3 (1946), p. 81, while in BMCCrete, p. 90, 14, and in Traite 2, 1, no. 1870, it is attributed to Carthaea on Ceos. Hoard evidence, such as the 1889 Hoard (IGCH 6) and the Santorini Hoard (IGCH 7) in which this issue appeared with staters of Aegina and several Cycladic islands, would indicate that the mint is to be located on one of the Cycladic islands. See also H. Bloesch, in S. Hurster and E. Paszthory, "Spätarchaischer Silberfund aus dem Antilibanon," eds., Essays Mildenberg (Wetteren, 1984), pp. 124-25.

artifact.name: Dewing 2350
artifact.commentary: Sometimes attributed to Miletus: see BMCIonia, p. 184, 6-11. Our coins quite possibly derive from one or both of the Santorini 1821 and Melos 1825 hoards (IGCH 7 and 8).
artifact.obverse_type: Forepart of lion, profile to the left, head reverted
artifact.reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

artifact.name: Dewing 2353
artifact.commentary: A tentative attribution to the dynast Pigres at Syangela has been proposed by G.E. Bean and J.M. Cook, "The Carian Coast, III" ABSA 52 (1957), pp. 95-146. The reverse pattern is discussed on O. Mørkholm and J. Zahle, "The Coinage of Kuprlli," ActaA 43 (1972), pp. 77-78. For other coins recently attributed to Syangela see U. Yarkin, "The Coinage of Syangela in Caria," NC 1975, pp. 12-18, and "More Coins of Syangela in Caria," NC 1977, pp. 152-153.
artifact.obverse_type: Griffin's head, profile to the left
artifact.reverse_type: Stellate pattern in square latticed frame with inverted sides; all set diagonally in incuse square

artifact.name: Dewing 2355
artifact.commentary: An Attribution to Mylasa has been suggested by E.S.G. Robinson, "A Hoard of Ancient Greek Coins from Anatolia," NC 1961, pp. 114-15, no. 37.

artifact.reverse_type: Incuse square divided by central band; in field, letters (?)

artifact.commentary: See H.A. Troxell, "Winged Carians," Essays Thompson, pp. 257-68, where Caunus and several lesser towns are considered as possible mints; Troxell Mint A, Period I, 7-8.

artifact.reverse_type: Rough triangular shape in incuse square

artifact.name: Dewing 2360
artifact.commentary: See H.A. Cahn, Knidos. Die Münzen des sechsten und des funften Jahrhunderts v. Chr., AMUGS 4 (Berlin, 1969); Cahn 1.1

artifact.name: Dewing 2384
artifact.commentary: The traditional attribution of the following coin to Poseidium on Karpathos has been thrown into considerable doubt by H.A. Cahn, "Poseidion on Karpathos?," NC 1957, pp. 11-12. Cahn has no alternative location to suggest for the mint, but says it must be on the coast, or on the islands, between Rhodes and Samos.
artifact.obverse_type: Two dolphins, the upper one profile to the left, the lower one profile to the right; below, a fish to the right; in upper corners, flowers
artifact.reverse_type: Incuse square divided by striped band

artifact.name: Dewing 2385
artifact.commentary: Based on G.F. Hill, "Some Coins of Southern Asia Minor," Anatolian Studies Presented to Sir William Ramsay (Manchester, 1923), pp. 207-9. Hill sees certain early Herakles heads in the series as portraits of Mausollos, comparing them to the Mausoleum statue in the British Museum and suggests that Artemisia is to be seen in the Demeter heads as on 2387. Although the statue is by no means accepted today as that of Mausollos himself, Hill's coin arrangement is in many ways more satisfactory than the traditional one.
artifact.obverse_type: Bearded head of Herakles, profile to the right (with features of Mausollos?)
artifact.reverse_type: Crab; below, club

artifact.name: Dewing 2387
artifact.obverse_type: Bearded head of Herakles, profile to the right (with features of Mausollos?)
artifact.reverse_type: Veiled head of Demeter, profile to the left (with features of Artemisia?)

artifact.reverse_type: Incuse square divided by central band

artifact.reverse_type: Rose; in left field, a prow. Border of dots.

artifact.reverse_type: Two incuse squares, one slightly larger

artifact.name: Dewing 2423
artifact.date_description: L. Weidauer argues for an earlier date, specifically one in the period 737/6-726 BC.
artifact.commentary: On the closing date of the important Foundation Deposit at the Ephesian Artemision (IGCH 1153) depends the dating of 2420-25, whose issues were all represented in the deposit. As yet, however, there is no consensus on its burial date.
artifact.obverse_type: Lion's head, profile to the right, with globular wart on nose; test cut on edge in the shape of bell
artifact.reverse_type: Two incuse squares, one slightly larger than the other

artifact.reverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the left; around, four dolphins; border of dots

artifact.name: Dewing 2431
artifact.commentary: This coin, of reduced weight [compared to others of similar issue], may have been struck later than the others: under Achaemenid rule.

artifact.reverse_type: Two incuse squares, one slightly larger than the other

artifact.name: Dewing 2436
artifact.commentary: See O. Morkholm, "The Classification of Lycian Coins before Alexander the Great," JNG 1964, pp. 65-76, followed in SNG von Aulock. The dates given are based on Morkholm, but reflect also the evidence of the Podalia, or Bucak, 1957 Hoard (IGCH 1262: N. Olcay and O. Mørkholm, "The Coin Hoard from Podalia," NC 1971, pp. 1-29) and the Asyut 1969 Hoard (Asyut, pp. 99-102).

artifact.reverse_type: Lion, profile to the left, attacking a bull; below, two rows of walls with towers and battlements

artifact.name: Dewing 2515
artifact.commentary: The attribution of 2515 is quite uncertain. Sometimes attributed to Golgi because of the (Ko), but Golgi is not known to have been an independent state in classical times.
artifact.obverse_type: Lion crouching, profile to the right
artifact.reverse_type: Bull walking, profile to the left

artifact.name: Dewing 2517
artifact.commentary: From one of the 1869 Dali Hoards. See M. J. Price, "Greek Coin Hoards in the British Museum," NC 1969, p. 1. BMCCyprus, p. 9, 5 (this coin).
artifact.obverse_type: Herakles advancing, profile to the right, wearing lion skin, carrying bow, and brandishing club over his head
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted square, a lion seated profile to the right

artifact.name: Dewing 2521
artifact.commentary: BMCCyprus, p. xxxiii, n. 1, and pl. 19, 3... attributed to the reign of Baalmelek II, although Baalram would also seem a possibility.
artifact.obverse_type: Herakles advancing, profile to the right, wearing lion skin, carrying bow, and brandishing club over his head
artifact.reverse_type: Lion, profile to the right, attacking stag

artifact.name: Dewing 2525
artifact.commentary: Dies of BMCCyprus, p. 28, 20-28 (erroneously headed Stasioikos), all from IGCH 1275: see note at 2517, above.
artifact.obverse_legend: Cypriot inscription: <foreign lang="Cypriot">V</foreign> (to l., sideways; only partially preserved = Sa, presumably for Stasicyprus).
artifact.obverse_type: Sphinx seated to the left on a vine branch which bears a tendril (below sphinx's belly) and a flower, on which the sphinx places one foot
artifact.reverse_type: Lotus blossom on two spiral tendrils; in left field, an ivy leaf; in right field, an astragalos

artifact.name: Dewing 2527
artifact.commentary: The obverse type has been obliterated, perhaps by the inadvertent blow of a hammer, or of a reverse die with square incuse, directly on the obverse side. The obverse description here is from comparison to other coins struck from our reverse die...illustrated in BMCCyprus, pl. 22, 2 (discussed on pp. lxxii-lxxiii)....
artifact.obverse_type: Bull standing to the left; above, a winged solar disk; in the left field, an ankh; below, (probably) an inscription
artifact.reverse_legend: To upper l., obliterated by die break, Cypriot inscription: <foreign lang="Cypriot">Ba O</foreign> (= King O[nasi]...).
artifact.reverse_type: Eagle flying to the left; in left field, trace of astragalos; all within an incuse square

artifact.name: Dewing 2529
artifact.commentary: The presence of the sprays on the reverse appears to rule out Nicodamus as the issuer, but the coin corresponds in all its details with none of the issues listed for Euelthon and his immediate successors in BMCCyprus, pp.lxxxv-lxxxviii.
artifact.obverse_type: Probable traces of an illegible inscription above. Ram lying to the left
artifact.reverse_type: Ankh with ring formed of dots; no inscription visible within ring; possible trace of unknown marking to right; all in incuse square with three-leaved sprays in each corner

artifact.name: Dewing 2530
artifact.obverse_type: Bearded head of Herakles, profile to the right, wearing lion skin headdress
artifact.reverse_type: Forepart of goat, profile to the right; below, club

artifact.name: Dewing 2533
artifact.obverse_type: Crowned bust of Aphrodite, profile to the left
artifact.reverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the left, wearing Corinthian helmet

artifact.name: Dewing 2534
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Aphrodite, profile to the left
artifact.reverse_type: Head of Artemis, profile to the right

artifact.name: Dewing 2566
artifact.commentary: Seleucia on the Tigris. ESM 188a (this coin).
artifact.obverse_type: Diademed head of Antiochos I, profile to the right; border of dots
artifact.reverse_type: Naked Apollo seated to the left on omphalos, holding arrow and bow; in left and right field, monograms

artifact.name: Dewing 2655
artifact.commentary: See Rouvier 13 (stater with a possibly similar inscription); 16-19 (obols of similar type).
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Dagon, wreathed, profile to the right. Border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Galley in left field, with shields above bulwark; above, an indeterminate object; below, waves in two zigzag lines. Border of dots.

artifact.name: Dewing 2662
artifact.obverse_type: Galley moving to the left; three hoplites with shields above the bulwark; above, a murex shell; below, a hippocamp, profile to the left. Border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Inscription off flan; lion attacking bull. Border of dots.

artifact.name: Dewing 2663
artifact.commentary: J.W. Betlyon, "A New Chronology for the Pre-Alexandrine Coinage of Sidon," ANSMN 21 (1976), pp. 11-35.
artifact.obverse_type: Phoenician war galley, with oars and row of shields along the bulwark, moving to the left; above, a character (9?); below, waves in two zigzag lines
artifact.reverse_type: Persian king (or hero) in right field, fighting lion

artifact.name: Dewing 2664
artifact.obverse_type: Phoenician war galley, with oars and a row of shields along the bulwark, moving to the left; above, an indistinguishable symbol; below, waves in four zigzag lines. Border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Persian king in chariot with driver, led by a pacing horse, profile to the left; in right field, the king of Sidon following, holding scepter and votive vase; above, two small circles

artifact.name: Dewing 2666
artifact.obverse_type: Phoenician war galley, with oars, and a row of shields along bulwark, moving to the left; above, an indistinct character; below, waves in two zigzag lines
artifact.reverse_type: Persian king (or hero), profile to the left, fighting a lion

artifact.name: Dewing 2669
artifact.commentary: J. Rouvier, "Numismatique des villes de la Phénicie: Tyr," JIAN 1903, pp. 269-332. Rouvier 1775.
artifact.obverse_type: Dolphin swimming, profile to the right; below, waves represented by zigzag lines and murex shell
artifact.reverse_type: Owl, head facing, standing, profile to the right; behind, Egyptian scepter and flail; edges of figures incised.

artifact.name: Dewing 2670
artifact.obverse_type: Melkaart riding hippocamp profile to the right; below, waves represented by zigzag lines and dolphin. Linear border
artifact.reverse_type: Owl, head facing, standing profile to the right; behind, Egyptian scepter and flail

artifact.name: Dewing 2672

artifact.reverse_type: Owl, head facing, standing profile to the right; behind, Egyptian scepter and flail. In right field, IIII

artifact.name: Dewing 2710

artifact.date_description: Le Rider's group 1, but this should postdate the examples of the Asyut and decadrachm hoard. Perhaps not before ca. 470 BC.
artifact.obverse_type: Satyr running to the right, carrying off nymph who gestures with both hands.
artifact.reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

artifact.name: BCMA 1914.6.2
artifact.obverse_type: Satyr running to the right, carrying off nymph
artifact.reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

artifact.name: BCMA 1914.6.3
artifact.obverse_type: Satyr running to the right, carrying off nymph who gestures with both hands
artifact.reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

artifact.name: BCMA 1914.6.6
artifact.obverse_type: Helmeted head of Athena, profile to the right, with olive wreath adorning helmet.
artifact.reverse_type: Owl, profile to the right; in left field, an olive sprig.

artifact.name: BCMA 1914.6.7
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Alexander the Great, profile to the right; border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Helmeted Athena seated on throne to the left, her left arm resting on shield; winged Nike stands on Athena's right hand, and crowns Lysimachos' name.

artifact.name: BCMA 1914.6.8
artifact.obverse_type: Gorgoneion
artifact.reverse_type: Wreathed female head, perhaps of Aphrodite, profile to the right

artifact.name: BCMA 1915.94
artifact.date_description: Following downdating necessitated by Asyut and the 'decadrachm' hoard, nearer 460 than early fifth century. See Price and Waggoner 1975, 40-42 and Price 1986, 46.
artifact.obverse_type: Lion, profile to the right, attacking a bull, profile to the left; above, rosette or theta; in exergue, set off by row of dots, floral pattern (acanthus) or boukranion?; border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square.

artifact.name: BCMA 1915.98
artifact.date_description: Second half of fourth century or later.
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Athena facing to the left, wearing Corinthian helmet.
artifact.reverse_type: Herakles stands facing forward, Nemean lion skin over his left arm, club in right; he is crowned by flying Nike.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.1
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Persephone, profile to the left; around, dolphins.
artifact.reverse_legend: In exergue, <foreign lang = "Greek">*S*U*R*A*K*O*S*I*W*N</foreign> and monogram <foreign lang = "Greek">*A*I</foreign>.
artifact.reverse_type: Quadriga galloping to the left, while the driver applies whip; above, triskeles.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.104
artifact.date_description: The reversion to the former reverse type of lion attacking stag is probably to be dated to the end of the fourth century or third century.
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the left, in Attic helmet with Pegasus. Behind her neck, <foreign lang = "Greek">*I*E</foreign> in square.
artifact.reverse_type: Lion attacking stag, profile to the left

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.12
artifact.date_description: Mid fifth century, or first three quarters of fourth century?
artifact.obverse_type: Boeotian shield.
artifact.reverse_type: Protome of horse galloping to the right

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.17
artifact.date_description: *F*I's name is given more fully elsewhere as Philistios. He seems to have been active in the late fourth and early third century.
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet with griffin.
artifact.reverse_type: Lion walking to the right; above: <foreign lang = "Greek">*F*I</foreign> and pentagram.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.18
artifact.obverse_type: Pegasus flying to the left
artifact.reverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the left, wearing Corinthian helmet; in field to the right, an anchor

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.19
artifact.obverse_type: Female head facing profile to the right
artifact.reverse_type: Ear of barley. In field, a plow (?).

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.2
artifact.obverse_type: Veiled head of Philistis (wife of Hieron 2), profile to the left
artifact.reverse_type: Quadriga galloping to the right, driven by winged Nike.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.21
artifact.obverse_type: Herakles wielding club wrestles Cretan bull.
artifact.reverse_type: Hypsas holds laurel branch in his left hand, and pours a libation on an altar with his right hand; in right field, leaf of selinon (celery) and heron.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.22
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the right; around, four dolphins.
artifact.reverse_type: Quadriga walking to the right; above, Nike, flying profile to the right, crowns horses; in exergue, ketos, profile to the right; border of dots.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.24
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the right; around, four dolphins.
artifact.reverse_type: Quadriga walking to the right; above, Nike, flying to the right, crowns horses; in exergue, ketos profile to the right

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.25
artifact.obverse_type: Naked boy rider crowning horse advancing to the left
artifact.reverse_type: Dolphin rider holding trident, profile to the left, crowned by flying Nike; to right, a grape cluster

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.26
artifact.date_description: Early obverse and reverse types of Athenian foundation: ca. 440 BC.
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet crowned with olive wreath.
artifact.reverse_type: Bull walking to the left

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.27
artifact.obverse_legend: Above horse, <foreign lang = "Greek">*I*O</foreign>, between legs in two lines <foreign lang = "Greek">*N*E*U *M*H</foreign>
artifact.obverse_type: Horseman advancing profile to the right, crowning horse.
artifact.reverse_legend: Below, <foreign lang = "Greek">*T*A*R*A*S</foreign>. Above to r, <foreign lang = "Greek">*P*O*L*Y</foreign>
artifact.reverse_type: Dolphin rider facing to the left, holding a helmet; in left and right field, starbursts.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.28
artifact.date_description: Wreathed Athena and walking bull are early types: ca. 440-430 BC?
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet crowned with olive wreath.
artifact.reverse_type: Bull walking to the right; in exergue, fish.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.29
artifact.obverse_type: Ear of barley.
artifact.reverse_type: Incuse ear of barley.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.3
artifact.obverse_type: Head of nymph, profile to the right
artifact.reverse_type: Winged Nike seated, profile to the left, with bird perched on raised right hand.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.31
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet with Scylla.
artifact.reverse_type: Bull charging to the right; in exergue, fish. Above bull, abbreviated name.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.37
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Alexander the Great, profile to the right, diademed and with horns of Ammon; border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Athena seated on throne to the left, her left arm resting on shield; winged Nike stands to the left on Athena's outstretched right hand, and crowns Lysimachos' name.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.39a
artifact.date_description: Le Rider group 8 (see Le Rider 1977, 189-191 with plate 4), dated ca. 180 to early first century. On style, this example probably belongs relatively early in the series.
artifact.obverse_type: Head of beardless Dionysos, profile to the right, wearing ivy wreath.
artifact.reverse_type: Herakles standing facing, looking to the right; with his right hand, he leans on the club, with the Nemean lion skin draped over his left arm, and his bow slung over his left shoulder. Between club and his right leg, a monogram.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.4
artifact.obverse_type: Squatting satyr. In field to to the left, a pellet.
artifact.reverse_type: Shallow incuse square divided into four equal parts.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.40
artifact.obverse_type: Satyr running to the right, carrying off nymph who gestures with both hands
artifact.reverse_type: Quadripartite incuse square

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.4a
artifact.date_description: Reign of Alexander the Great (336-323 BC) or later.
artifact.obverse_type: Beardless head of Herakles in Nemean lion skin, profile to the right; border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Zeus seated to the left on a throne; in left hand, a scepter; seated on his extended right hand, an eagle; border of dots. Mint of Babylon.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.58
artifact.obverse_type: Tripod.
artifact.reverse_type: Incuse tripod.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.5a
artifact.date_description: ca. 342/1-329/8 BC according to Le Rider 1977 (group 2 B of Amphipolis). Le Rider's chronology is rejected by Price 1979 and Martin 1985 Appendix 4.
artifact.obverse_type: Laureate head of Zeus, profile to the right
artifact.reverse_type: Horseman carrying palm rides profile to the right; below horse's front legs, janiform head

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.63
artifact.obverse_type: Amphora; sprouting from top, vines.
artifact.reverse_type: Starburst consisting of eight large rays alternating with eight small rays; in center, six dots around a central dot; border of dots.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.64
artifact.date_description: ca. 480 BC? This obol appears to belong to Williams' Period 1 (which he dates ca. 510-478: see Williams 1972), and may have been part of the increased production of coinage at Phocis at the time of the Persian invasion.
artifact.obverse_type: Bull protome, profile to the right
artifact.reverse_type: Boar protome, profile to the right, within incuse square.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.65
artifact.date_description: Early in the period 234/3-168 BC (duration of the Koinon of Epirus). See Franke 1961, 139-140 for the argument and hoard evidence that the official KE(phalos) was active early in the lifetime of the Koinon, with catalog entries 166-168.
artifact.commentary: See <bibl>Franke 1961</bibl>-- there are 16 examples of this obverse/reverse combination with the monogram of the official KE. This is the most common obverse/reverse pair for drachms of the Epirote republic.
artifact.obverse_type: Wreathed head of Zeus, profile to the right; behind head, ligature of <foreign lang = "Greek">*K*E</foreign>; border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Eagle with closed wings perched to the right on thunderbolt; around, oak wreath.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.66
artifact.date_description: Mid fifth century, or first three quarters of fourth century?
artifact.obverse_type: Boeotian shield
artifact.reverse_type: Protome of horse galloping to the right

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.67
artifact.obverse_type: Tripod; to the left, a heron.
artifact.reverse_type: Incuse tripod.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.68
artifact.date_description: *F*I's name is given more fully elsewhere as Philistios. He seems to have been active in the late fourth and early third century.
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet with griffin.
artifact.reverse_type: Lion walking to the right; above, dolphin and retrograde <foreign lang = "Greek">*F*I</foreign>.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.73
artifact.date_description: Second half of fourth century or later.
artifact.obverse_type: Female head, below between legs
artifact.reverse_legend: In exergue, <foreign lang = "Greek">*N*E*O*P*O*L*I*T*W*N</foreign>, below bull <foreign lang = "Greek">*I*S</foreign>
artifact.reverse_type: Bull with human face, walking to the right; flying Nike crowns with wreath.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.78
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the right; around, four dolphins.
artifact.reverse_type: Quadriga walking to the right; border of dots.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.8
artifact.obverse_type: Poseidon steps to the right, with trident raised in his right hand.
artifact.reverse_type: Bull walking profile to the left

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.8 D
artifact.date_description: Kraay suggests ca. 420-410 BC for this series with numbered dies. In this example, obverse die three (G) is combined with reverse die three.
artifact.obverse_type: Poseidon steps to the right with trident raised in his right hand.
artifact.reverse_type: Bull walking profile to the left

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.89
artifact.date_description: After Starr's Group 5 (see chapter 4 of Starr 1970), part of the massive issues of tetradrachms that began around the middle of the fifth century BC and continued through the third quarter of the century.
artifact.obverse_type: Helmeted head of Athena, profile to the right; olive wreath adorns helmet.
artifact.reverse_type: Owl, profile to the right; in left field, olive sprig and crescent.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.8b
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Arethusa, profile to the right; around, four dolphins.
artifact.reverse_type: Quadriga walking profile to the left; above, Nike flying to the left, crowns horse.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.95
artifact.obverse_type: Helmeted head of Athena, profile to the right; olive wreath adorns helmet.
artifact.reverse_type: Owl with closed wings facing between two olive sprigs.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.97
artifact.date_description: Posthumous issue of Philip 2, either Le Rider's series Pella 3 (ca. 323/2- ca. 315 BC) or Amphipolis 4 (after 315 BC). Le Rider's chronology is rejected by Price 1979 and Martin 1985 Appendix 4.
artifact.obverse_type: Male head wearing tainia, profile to the right; border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Horseman galloping profile to the right; below, club of Herakles.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.98
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet with Scylla.
artifact.reverse_type: Owl standing to the right with closed wings; in right field, an olive sprig. Signature off flan.

artifact.name: BCMA 1919.58.99
artifact.date_description: Middle to second half of the fifth century.
artifact.obverse_type: Apollo striding to the right, on his right arm, a small figure; in right field, a small stag with head turned back to Apollo
artifact.reverse_type: Stag standing to the left

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.1
artifact.date_description: Close to Starr's group 5 (see Starr 1970). Perhaps ca. 450-440 BC.
artifact.obverse_type: Helmeted head of Athena, profile to the right; wreath adorns helmet.
artifact.reverse_type: Owl standing profile to the right; in left field, olive sprig and crescent.

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.2
artifact.obverse_type: Ephebe on horse riding to the right; shield slung over his back, he holds a spear in his upraised right hand.
artifact.reverse_type: Man riding dolphin to the left; small dolphin below.

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.37
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the right, wearing Attic helmet with seahorse.
artifact.reverse_type: Herakles wrestling the Nemean lion; in left field, his club.

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.38
artifact.obverse_type: Naked youth crowns horse advancing to the left
artifact.reverse_type: Man riding dolphin, profile to the left, holding a kantharos in his extended right arm

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.39

artifact.reverse_type: Bull charging profile to the right

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.45

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.46

artifact.reverse_type: Eagle on dolphin, both profile to the left

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.47
artifact.obverse_type: Pegasus flying to the left
artifact.reverse_type: Head of Athena, profile to the left, wearing Corinthian helmet; in right field, a bow.

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.49
artifact.date_description: Mid fifth century, or first three quarters of fourth century?
artifact.obverse_type: Boeotian shield
artifact.reverse_type: Protome of horse galloping to the right, within incuse square

artifact.reverse_type: Volute crater in incuse square.

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.52

artifact.reverse_type: Kantharos in incuse square; in field above, club of Herakles.

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.53
artifact.obverse_type: Boeotian shield.
artifact.reverse_type: Kantharos in incuse square; in field above, club of Herakles.

artifact.name: BCMA 1920.8.55

artifact.obverse_type: Helmeted head of Athena, profile to the right; olive wreath adorns helmet.
artifact.reverse_type: Owl profile to the right; in left field, olive sprig and crescent.

artifact.obverse_type: Helmeted head of Athena, profile to the right; border of dots.
artifact.reverse_type: Owl perched to the right on an amphora; around, olive wreath.

artifact.reverse_type: Snarling lion's head, profile to the right; around, four ears of barley.

artifact.name: BCMA 1923.118.4

artifact.reverse_type: Wreath of two ears of wheat.

artifact.name: BCMA 1923.118.5
artifact.date_description: Two similar drachms of Tanagra were found in the Asyut hoard, dated to ca. 480 BC. See numbers 248 and 249 in the catalog of Price and Waggoner 1975.

artifact.reverse_type: Incuse square in four sections. In two sections, <foreign lang = "Greek">*T</foreign>.

artifact.reverse_type: Crescent.

artifact.name: BCMA 1958.18.5

artifact.reverse_type: Zeus seated to the left on a throne, with a scepter in his left hand, and an eagle seated on his extended right hand; border of dots.

artifact.name: Boston 1997.89
artifact.obverse_type: Bust of Septimius Severus, laureate, draped, cuirassed, facing bust of Caracalla, laureate, draped and cuirassed
artifact.reverse_type: In center Hercules seated on lionskin over a rock, club in left hand, cantharus in right. At left stands Apollo holding plectron and lyre, and Artemis, drawing arrow from quiver. At right Tyche, cornucopia in left hand, placing wreath on Hercules' head.

artifact.name: Boston 1997.95
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Bust of Philip I, laureate, cuirassed, facing right, with aegis on left shoulder
artifact.reverse_type: Serapis seated in the center with Cerberus at his feet. At left, Demeter, holding a torch and Anubis-Hermes with kerykeion; at right, Harpocrates holding cornucopia and Isis holding sistrum and cornucopia

artifact.name: Boston 1987.491
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.comparanda: See <hi rend="ital">Monnaies et Medailles. Vent Publique</hi> 52 (1975), lot 740, from a hoard discovered in a Roman wreck off Corsica in the mid 19th century.
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP C M AVRL CLAVDIVS P F AVG
artifact.obverse_type: Bust of Claudius II Gothicus, laureate, cuirassed, facing right, with aegis on left shoulder, horseman (emperor?) and enemy (?) on breastplate
artifact.reverse_type: Concordia stands slightly to the left, with her head right, holding in each hand a standard, each topped by a bird

artifact.name: Boston 1997.63
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Alexandria, 59, no. 488 (obverse with aegis, not drapery)
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Bust of Trajan, laureate, facing right, with drapery on his left shoulder
artifact.reverse_type: Demeter stands at left, long torch in right hand, grain sheaf in left, with a calathus on her head. She faces a figure seated left, probably Euthenia, who holds grain ears in her right hand and a scepter in her left

artifact.name: Boston 1997.93
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: NERO CLAVD CAESAR AVG GER P M TR P IMP P P
artifact.obverse_type: Bust of Nero, laureate, facing right, with aegis. Globe below
artifact.reverse_legend: ANNONA AVGVSTI CERES; S C (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: At left Annona (personification of the yearly harvest), standing, cradling a cornucopia in her left hand, with her outer robe falling from her body, and her right hand on her hip. She faces a seated Ceres, with her feet on a low stool, holding a torch in her left hand and corn ears in her right hand. Between them, modius on garlanded altar. Behind them is the stern of ship.

artifact.name: Boston 1997.88
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.comparanda: Cf. Joseph G. Milne, <hi rend="ital">Catalogue of Alexandrian Coins</hi> (Oxford 1933), 18, no. 620
artifact.obverse_type: Bust of Trajan, laureate, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Trajan holding eagle-topped staff and laurel branch, facing right in elephant quadriga

artifact.name: Boston 1997.94
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IVLIA IMP T AVG F AVGVSTA (no crossbars on A's)
artifact.obverse_type: Bust of Julia Titi, draped, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: VESTA (in exergue); S C (left and right in field)
artifact.reverse_type: Vesta seated left, with palladium on right hand and transverse scepter in left

artifact.name: Boston 1997.91
artifact.sources_used: E. T. Newell, <hi rend="ital">Western Seleucid Mints</hi> (New York 1941) no. 1529
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Horned head of bridled horse, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Elephant walking to right; star above and anchor below

artifact.name: Boston 1997.92
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.comparanda: John May, <hi rend="ital">Coinage of Abdera (540-345 B.C.)</hi> (London 1966) no. 161
artifact.obverse_type: Within dotted circle, griffin springing left. Kantharos in field above.
artifact.reverse_type: Within incuse, inscription around raised square divided into four parts

artifact.name: Boston 1996.107
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Constantine I, facing right, glancing up, wearing pearl diadem
artifact.reverse_legend: GLORIA CONS TANTINI AVG; SMTS (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Constantine moving right, laureate, draped and cuirassed, with a trophy over his left shoulder and a transverse spear in his right hand. To the left and right at his feet, seated captives looking up at him.

artifact.name: Boston 1997.84
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Sicily, 48, no. 35; McFadden, E. J., <hi rend="ital">Minerva</hi> 8 (1997) 58, illus.

artifact.reverse_legend: DIVO AVG (across field, left and right); S C (below, but also across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Caligula, with two attendants (the one on the left holds the sacrificial bull while the one on the right holds a patera, as does Caligula), sacrificing at an altar before the garlanded, hexastyle, Ionic Temple of Divus Augustus. A facing quadriga is placed at the apex of the roof, between two victories holding shields above their heads, and two male figures (Aeneas and Ascanius?) and a figure holding a torch. The pediment is decorated with Mars between four small figures.

artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bust of Faustina Major, draped, facing right. Her hair is arranged in braids on top of her head and a band of pearls adorns her hair at the front.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped figure of Aeternitas (Eternity), is seated near profile to the left on a low stool. She holds a phoenix on a globe in her right hand and a scepter in her left.

artifact.name: Boston 32.1231

artifact.reverse_type: The draped and veiled figure of Pietas (Piety), standing in 3/4-view to the left, drops incense out of her right hand over a lighted "candelabrum altar", at left, and holds a box in her left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 35.274
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: FAVSTINA AVG ANTONINI AVG PII PP (around)

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, Venus standing in 3/4-view to the right, draws her drapery over her shoulder with her right hand, and holds an apple in her left hand

artifact.name: Boston 63.1620
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Faustina Major, facing right. Her hair is arranged in braids on top of her head.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the veiled and draped figure of Ceres stands in 3/4-view to the left, holding a torch in her right hand and a scepter in her left

artifact.name: Boston 97.220

artifact.reverse_type: A peacock walks to the right, with its head turned to the left

artifact.name: Boston 32.1224
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> IV, 64, nos. 454-457; pl. 10.4; <bibl><hi rend="ital">RIC</hi></bibl> III, 72, no. 377

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a throne, facing frontal, draped and ornamented. A wreath is placed on the seat, while a scepter lies at a diagonal across the throne, pointing up to the left. A low table (or footstool ?) appears in front of the throne.

artifact.name: Boston 32.1227
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> IV, 56, nos. 374-378; pl. 9.3, see xliii for date

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a draped figure, perhaps that of Providentia (Providence), standing slightly to the left. She wears a veil that billows out and around behind her, which she holds in her left hand. In her right hand she holds a globe.

artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, stands the draped figure of Hilaritas (the personification of cheerfulness) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a long palm in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm.

artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bare bust of Marcus Aurelius, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the wreathed and draped figure of Fides (Faith), in 3/4-view to the right. She holds two corn ears in her right hand and a plate of fruit in her upraised left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 32.911

artifact.name: Boston 1961 Apparatus no. 1

artifact.reverse_type: The draped figure of Venus is seated near profile to the left. She holds a scepter upright in her left hand, and a figure of Cupid in her outstretched right hand. Cupid holds a garland in both hands. Below her seat is a dove, facing left.

artifact.name: Boston 54.570
artifact.donor: In memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped figure of Providentia (Providence) in 3/4-view to the left. She raises her right hand toward a large star in the upper left field, and places her left hand on her breast.

artifact.name: Boston 35.262
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Commodus, facing right

He holds a scepter in his left hand and a thunderbolt, as well as his cape, in his right. A smaller, togate figure of the emperor, Commodus, stands below his right arm, in a near frontal pose, raising his right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 40.180
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Commodus, bearded and draped, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: TR P VII IMP VI COS IIII P P (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped figure of Abbondantia (Abundance) in 3/4-view to the right. She holds a plate of fruit in her left hand and ears of wheat, drooping downwards, in her right.

artifact.name: Boston 64.2136
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Commodus, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: P M TR P VIIII IMP VI COS IIII P P (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the nude, bearded figure of Hercules, near frontal, with his head profile to the right. He rests his right hand on his hip and rests his left arm on his club, around which is wrapped his lion skin, set on a rock.

artifact.name: Boston 64.2138
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> IV, 843, no. 718, variable obverse spacing.
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: L AEL AVREL COMM AVG P FEL (around)

artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle, stands the draped figure of Africa (the personification of that region), profile to the right, shaking hands with the nude figure of Commodus, as Hercules, standing in 3/4-view to the left. Their joined hands also clasp corn ears. Commodus rests his right foot on the prow of a ship and holds a club, in his left hand, which he rests on a rock. Africa holds a sistrum in her left hand, and a lion reclines to the right, at her feet.

artifact.name: Boston 1986.896

She holds corn ears in her left hand and rests her right arm on her throne. At right are a winged genius (standing profile to the left) and the prow of a ship.

Septimius addresses two soldiers and an officer, all in military costume, standing in 3/4-back view, to the left. A legionary eagle (aquila) is held by one of the soldiers.

Vermeule, <hi rend="ital">Proceedings of the American Philosophical Society</hi> 109 (1965) 381, note 61; <bibl>Vermeule 1968, 146-47, fig. 74</bibl>; <bibl>Romans and Barbarians</bibl>, no. Above, Helios (Sun) rides in a quadriga of horses (with a crescent above) to the right, while Selene (Moon) rides to the left in a biga of bulls (with a star above). Below are the reclining figures of Gaia (Earth) and Thalassa (Sea).

artifact.name: Boston 1974.500
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.reverse_legend: IOVI CONSERVATORI (around); ALE (in exergue); A (in right field)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the cloaked, bearded figure of Jupiter, standing in 3/4-view to the left, holding on his right hand a figure of Victoria (Victory), awarding him a wreath, and in his left hand a scepter, upright. An eagle sits besides his right foot.

artifact.name: Boston 59.497
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Chase & Vermeule 1972, 271, fig. 271</bibl>; W.M. Whitehill, <hi rend="ital">Boston Museum of Fine Arts, A Centennial History</hi> (Cambridge 1970) 665-66, illus.; MFA <hi rend="ital">The Rathbone Years</hi> (Boston 1972) 42, no. 27, 2, illus.; <hi rend="ital">Boston Museum of Fine Arts Illustrated Handbook</hi> (Boston 1976) 132-33, 2 illus.; R.A.G. artifact.obverse_legend: IMP C M AUR MAXIMIANVS P F AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the head of Maximianus Herculeus, bearded, facing right. He is in the guise of Hercules, wearing the lion skin helmet.
artifact.reverse_legend: HERCVLI COMITI AVGG ET CAES N (around); PR (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the nude figure of Hercules, standing near frontal, looking left. In his right hand he holds a bow, on a globe, and in his left, his bow. The lion skin is draped over his left shoulder and his quiver is at his back.

artifact.name: Boston 59.506
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the head of Maxentius, bearded and wearing a radiate crown, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: HERCVLI COMITI AVG N (around); PR (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the nude figure of Hercules, laureate, standing frontal but looking to the right. He holds his club downward in his right hand. The lion's skin is draped over his left arm, and he holds a bow in his left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 59.507
artifact.sources_used: J. Polzer, <hi rend="ital">AJA</hi> 77 (1973) 372, no. 1; <bibl><hi rend="ital">RIC</hi></bibl> VI, 372 no. 166
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the head of Maxentius, bearded, facing left. He is in the guise of Hercules, here wearing the lion's skin, with the paws knotted at his neck.
artifact.reverse_legend: CONSERVATOR VRB SVAE (around); P * R (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, Maxentius receives a globe from Roma (Rome). At left, Maxentius wears a laurel wreath, cuirass, and paludamentum, and stands frontal, looking to the right. He holds a spear in his left hand, and receives the globe with his right hand. Helmeted and draped Roma, at right, is seated in 3/4-view to the left, holding a spear in her left hand. She is seated on a shield decorated with Romulus, Remus, and the she-wolf under a tree.

artifact.name: Boston 60.4
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 7.244, no. 139</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 1.16, no. 9</bibl>; pl. VI, no. 12; J. Maurice, <hi rend="ital">Numismatique Constantinienne, iconographie et chronologie</hi> (Paris 1908-1912) 3.58, XII
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Constantine I, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the Emperor Constantine I rides profile to the right on horseback. He raising his right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 58.698
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 7.381, no. 139</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 1.24, no. 6; <bibl>Romans and Barbarians, 159, no. C126, illus.</bibl>; <bibl><hi rend="ital">RIC</hi></bibl> 196, under no. 360

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the Caesar, Constantine II, dressed in military costume, standing in the pose of Virtus (Valor), 3/4-view to the left, with his right foot on the suppliant, Sarmatia (the personification of that Region). He holds an orb in his extended right hand and a reversed spear upright in his left hand.

artifact.sources_used: R. artifact.reverse_type: Bull walking to the left, with head turned facing

artifact.name: Boston 59.489
artifact.obverse_legend: M COMMODVS ANTONINVS PIVS FELIX AVG BRIT (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Commodus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right. His shoulders are shown in 3/4-back view.
artifact.reverse_legend: HERC COMMODIANO P M TR P XVI IMP VIII (around); COS VI P P (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the half-draped figure of Commodus-Hercules, stands in 3/4-view to the left, toward a tree. He holds a cornucopia in his left hand and in his right hand a patera over a burning altar, against which his rests club. His lion skin and quiver hang in the tree, and his bow leans against its trunk.

artifact.name: Boston 59.251
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate half figure of Gallienus, bearded, facing right. He wears a light cloak and holds a caduceus on his left shoulder with his left hand.
artifact.reverse_type: The winged figure of Victoria (Victory) awarding a crown to the Emperor Gallienus. Victoria, at left, stands in profile to the right. The Emperor, at right, stands in 3/4-view to the left, holds a scepter in his left hand and receives the crown with his right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 35.1463
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">RIC</hi></bibl> IV.3, 74, no. 54; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 5.96, no. 14</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 1.48, no. 4</bibl> = Cohen I (14) variant; M. artifact.name: Boston 34.1387

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stand three draped Monetae (personifications of the Mints) in 3/4-view to the left. Each holds scales and a cornucopia, with a heap of metal at her feet.

He places his left foot in back of a seated barbarian, in eastern dress, with a pointed hat.

artifact.name: Boston 35.1457
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.name: Boston 68.613

artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Domitian, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the emperor Domitian and Victoria (Victory), standing in 3/4-view to the left. The emperor, in military costume, holds a thunderbolt in his right hand and a spear in his left. Victoria, draped, holds a palm branch in her left hand and in her right hand a wreath, with which she crowns him.

artifact.name: Boston 35.261

artifact.reverse_type: The half-nude, winged figure of Victoria (Victory) standing near profile to the right, rests her left foot on a helmet and inscribes a round shield that is supported by a palm trunk

artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped figure of Abbondantia (Abundance) slightly to the right, holding a cornucopia in her left arm. A child stands at left.

artifact.name: Boston 1972.76
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP CAES VESPASIANVS AVG P M T P P P COS III (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Vespasian, wearing the aegis, facing right

artifact.reverse_type: The helmeted figure of Roma, dressed as an Amazon, sits near profile to the right on a pile of seven rocks that represent the hills of Rome. She holds a parazonium on her left knee. Before her the personification of the Tiber River reclines, holding a reed.

artifact.name: Boston 35.1455
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.reverse_type: The draped figure of Pax (Peace) standing in 3/4-view to the left, holds an olive branch in her extended right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm.

artifact.name: Boston 59.482
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Plotina, facing right. She wears a double crown and hair is tied at the nape of her neck, where it falls down her back.
artifact.reverse_legend: FIDES AVGUST (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped figure of Fides (Faith) slightly to the right. She holds corn ears in her right hand and a dish of fruit in her upraised left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 65.446
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> III, 466, no. 1485 (DISCIPLINA); <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 2, no. 547</bibl>; <bibl>Romans and Barbarians, 82, no. C22, illus.</bibl>

artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Hadrian, bearded and draped, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: S C (across field, left and right); DISCIPVLINA / AVG (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, Hadrian followed by a centurion and three soldiers, of diminishing height. All are cloaked and stand in 3/4-view to the right. Hadrian holds a baton (?) in his right hand. The three soldiers carrying military standards, the first the legionary eagle (aquila) and the second the vexillum.

artifact.name: Boston 35.1458
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: SABINA AVGVSTA HADRIANI AVG P P (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Sabina, facing right. She wears a diadem and her hair falls down her neck, at the bottom of which it is tied.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the draped and veiled figure of Pietas (Piety) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a patera in her right hand and a scepter upright in her left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 35.237
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: ANTONINVS AVG PIVS P P TR P COS III (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Antoninus Pius, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: PROVIDENTIAE DEORVM (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a thunderbolt with eight darts

artifact.name: Boston 35.276
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Toynbee 1944, 149, no. 25, pl. 47.5</bibl>; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 6, no. 380</bibl>; <bibl>Greek & Roman Portraits 1972, no. 79</bibl>
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP C PROBVS P F AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate half figure of Probus, facing left. He wears the paludamentum (cape) over a cuirass, and in his right hand holds a globe surmounted by a diminutive figure of winged Victoria (Victory) who offers him a wreath.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stand the draped figures of three Monetae (personifications of the Mints). The first and last stand in 3/4-view to the left, while the middle one stands near frontal, turning her head to the left. Each carries scales in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm. A heap of metal is piled at the feet of each figure.

artifact.name: Boston 34.1425
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: The draped bust of Julia Soaemias, facing right. She wears a diadem over her waved her that is looped at her neck.
artifact.reverse_legend: VENVS CAELESTIS (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the crowned and draped figure of Venus, in 3/4-view to the left, holding an apple in her right hand and a scepter upright in her left hand. A star appears in the right field.

artifact.name: Boston 35.224
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Julia Maesa, diademed, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: SAECVLI FELICITAS (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped figure of Felicitas (Felicity) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a patera in her right hand and a caduceus in her left hand. A slim altar stands at left.

artifact.name: Boston 34.1431
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP CAES D CAEL BALBINVS AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Antoninus Pius, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: PROVIDENTIA DEORVM (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped figure of Providentia (Providence) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a cornucopia in her left arm and points with a stick in her right hand to a globe at her feet.

artifact.name: Boston 35.1453
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.reverse_legend: S C (across field, left and right)

artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.reverse_type: An eagle, standing in 3/4-view to the right, on a thunderbolt. A palm branch appears in the right field.

artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Head of Cnaeus Pompeius Magnus (Pompey), facing right. Pitcher in left field. Lituus in right field. Pompey's characteristic cow-lick (anastole) recalls the image of Alexander the Great.

Neptune stands in 3/4-view to the left, wearing a diadem, holding an aplustre in his right hand, and a cloak over left arm, and rests his right foot on the prow of a ship.

artifact.name: Boston 58.516

artifact.reverse_legend: L FLAMINIVS (down, in right field); IIII VIR (up, in left field)

artifact.name: Boston 67.1027

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a horseman, with a tall, conical hat and a torch (?) in his left hand, gallops with two horses to the right. Wreath in left field.

artifact.name: Boston 66.824
artifact.sources_used: G. Lahusen, <hi rend="ital">Die BildnismÃ¼nzen der römischen Republik</hi> (Munich 1989) 20-21; <bibl>Vermeule 1978, 52, 190, 275, fig. 56</bibl>; <bibl><hi rend="ital">RRC</hi></bibl> no. 439/1, pl. LII; <bibl>Sydenham 1952, no. 1147</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type:
A bare male head, profile to the right. Triskeles symbol in left field.

Traditionally this head has been taken to represent the Consul, M. Claudius Marcellus. But Lahusen has now argued that the person represented is Cn. Cornelius Lentulus Marcellinus, consul in 56 B.C.
artifact.reverse_legend: MARCELLVS (down, in right field); COS QVINQ (down, in left field)
artifact.reverse_type: M. Claudius Marcellus, holding a trophy in both hands, approaches a tetrastyle temple
