artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bare head of Otho, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped figure of Securitas (Security) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a wreath in her right hand and a scepter in her left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 64.49
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> II, 350, no. 249, var. (AVGVSTA, A's written without cross bars); <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 1.535, no. 4</bibl>; J. J. Herrmann, Jr., <hi rend="ital">Journal of the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston</hi> 3 (1991) 39 (fig. 7), 41; see <bibl>Robertson 1982, 1.329 for date</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: DOMITIA AVG IMP DOMITIAN AVG GERM (around; there is no cross bar on the first A)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Domitia, facing right. Her hair is piled in curls on her forehead but tied in a long pony tail at the back.
artifact.reverse_legend: CONCORDIA AVGVST (around; there is no cross bar on the second A)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands a peacock, profile to the right

artifact.name: Boston 34.1412
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Draped bust of Marciana, facing right. She wears a diadem over several tiers of curls and her hair is tied in an elaborate chignon at the back.
artifact.reverse_type: An eagle with spread wings marches in 3/4-view to the left on a scepter, but looks back to the right

artifact.name: Boston 53.2018
artifact.donor: In memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Faustina I (Faustina Major). Her hair is characteristically braided and piled up in an elaborate bun on the top of her head.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands a draped female figure (Venus?) in 3/4-view to the left, with her right hand raised.

artifact.name: Boston 54.656
artifact.donor: In memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP CAES M AVREL ANTONINVS AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Marcus Aurelius, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: CONCORDIAE AVGVSTOR TR P XV (around); COS III (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stand the togate figures of Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus, shaking their right hands. One stands profile to the right and the other in 3/4-view to the left.

artifact.name: Boston 67.599
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Faustina II (Faustina Minor), facing right. Her wavy hair is gathered in a large bun at the nape of her neck.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped figure of Cybele is enthroned in 3/4-view to the right. She wears a turreted crown and holds her tympanum on her left knee. Her throne is flanked by lions at left and right.

artifact.name: Boston 52.1014
artifact.donor: In memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Laureate bust of Commodus, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: TR P III IMP II COS P P (around)
artifact.reverse_type: Castor, wreathed and nude, except for his cloak, stands in 3/4-view to the left, in front of his horse. He holds a reversed spear in his left hand and the reins in his right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 69.1056
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> IV, 700, no. 74, slight variation in spacing of reverse legend; <bibl>Romans and Barbarians</bibl>, 83, no. C30, illus.
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Commodus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: TR P VII IMP IIII COS III P P (around); LIBERAL V (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: The togate figure of Commodus is seated on a platform in 3/4-view to the left, extending his right hand. At his left stands a soldier, near profile to the left, holding a staff (?). At his right stands the draped figure of Liberalitas (Liberality), in 3/4-view to the left, holding an abacus in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm. A togate citizen at left mounts a ladder to ascend the platform, with a bowl (of grain?) in his arms.

artifact.name: Boston 54.657
artifact.donor: In memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of of Septimius Severus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: P M TR P XI COS III P P (around)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the draped figure of Fortuna (Fortune) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a rudder in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm. Under her seat is a wheel.

artifact.name: Boston 64.5
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of of Septimius Severus, bearded, facing right. He wears the aegis around his shoulders.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Julia Domna, facing right. Her hair, which is waved in six ridges, is gathered loosely in a complex bun at the back of her head.

artifact.name: Boston 67.1013
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> V, 51, no. 189, variable spacing in reverse legend; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 4, no. 593</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of of Caracalla, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped figure of Spes (Hope), walks in profile to the left. She holds part of her skirt in her left hand and a flower in her right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 35.270
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> V, 607, no. 430 (PMTRP III); <bibl><hi rend="ital">RIC</hi></bibl> IV.2, 54, no. 319; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 4.341, 188</bibl>
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP CAES M AVR ANTONINVS PIVS AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: The draped bust of Elagabalus, wearing a radiate crown, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: P M TR P IIII COS III P P (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: The figure of Sol (Sun), wearing a radiate crown and a cape, runs in 3/4-view to the left, raising his right arm and holding a whip in his left hand. A star appears in the left field.

artifact.name: Boston 63.1621
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP C M AVR SEV ALEXAND AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Severus Alexander, bearded and draped, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: P M TR P VI COS II P P (around)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the togate figure of Severus Alexander in 3/4-view to the left, facing a lighted altar, over which he holds a patera, with his right hand. In his left hand he holds a scroll.

artifact.name: Boston 66.426
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">RIC</hi></bibl> V.1, 284 no. 172; <bibl>Romans and Barbarians, 155, no. C101, illus.</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP C L DOM AVRELIANVS AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Aurelian, bearded and wearing a radiate crown, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the cloaked Genius of the Roman People, in 3/4-view to the left. He wears a modius (grain basket) on his head, holds a patera in his right hand, and a cornucopia in his left arm. Military standard in right field.

artifact.name: Boston 68.752
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">RIC</hi></bibl> V.2, 189, no. 371; Whitehill, W. M., <hi rend="ital">Museum of Fine Arts Boston. A Centennial History</hi> (Cambridge 1970) 666, illus.; <bibl>Romans and Barbarians, 156, no. C107, illus.</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Numerianus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and winged figure of Victoria (Victory), rides in a biga in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a wreath in her right hand and a palm in her left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1970.261
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">RIC</hi></bibl> V.2, 162, no. 193; <bibl>Romans and Barbarians, 156, no. C106, illus.</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: M AVR CARINVS P F NOB CAES (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Carinus, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stand the togate prince and the emperor,in military attire with a scepter. On their clasped hands they support a figure of winged Victoria (Victory) holding a globe and a wreath.

artifact.name: Boston 53.2023
artifact.donor: In memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle the draped bust of Magnia Urbica, diademed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle the draped figure of Concordia (Harmony) seated in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a patera in her outstretched right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm.

artifact.name: Boston 59.494
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">RIC</hi></bibl> VI, 615, no. 1; <hi rend="ital">Illustrated London News</hi>, Nov. 14, 1959
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Diocletian, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: CONSVL VII P P PROCOS (around); SMA (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the togate and laureate figure of the emperor, standing in 3/4-view to the left, wearing a baldric over his left shoulder. He holds the globe in his right hand and a scepter at a diagonal in his left hand. Dot in lower left field, star in lower right field.

artifact.name: Boston 63.84
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Trajan, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bearded figure of Mars or Virtus, standing in near frontal view, slightly to the left, looking right. He wears cuirass and helmet and holds a shield in lowered left hand, a spear in his right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 63.81
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Nerva, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, stands a nude, radiate figure, in a frontal pose, on the summit of Mt. Argaeus. He holds a globe in his right hand and a scepter in his left.

artifact.name: Boston 63.1497
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Sabina, facing right. She wears a crown over her hair, which is bound at her back.
artifact.reverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*A*M*I*S*O*U *E*L*E*U*Q*E*R*A*S *E*T*O*U*S *P*C*Q</Foreign> (around; the last part refers to the year 169 = 136 A.D.)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle crouches the nude figure of Venus, profile to the right, although she turns her head to the left. She wears a crown (stephane) and holds a mirror in her right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 63.76
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Vespasian, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the togate figure of Domitian, in 3/4-view to the left. He holds an olive branch in his right hand and a scroll in his left.

artifact.name: Boston 63.77
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Domitian, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the togate emperor rides in a quadriga, profile to the right. The emperor holds a laurel branch in his right hand and a scepter in his left. A trophy and a captive decorate the side of the chariot, and a wreath decorates the front.

artifact.name: Boston 63.79
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Domitian, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Domitia, facing right. She wears a stephane (crown) over a large pile of curls over her forehead. Her hair at back is arranged in a series of braids, joined at the nape of her neck.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.7
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Sabina, facing right. Her long hair is arranged in a series of braids that are wrapped around her head.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands Artemis, dressed in a short garment, in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a bow in her lowered left hand and raises her right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 63.2645
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Mionnet 1806-1838</bibl>, 168, no. 181, without aegis, for year lll (AIP)
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Nero, wearing the aegis, facing left
artifact.reverse_type: An eagle standing on a club, in 3/4-view to the left. A palm branch stands upright, at left.

artifact.name: Boston 60.1150
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Galatia, Cappadocia, and Syria, 182, no. 258
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Domitian, facing right. At lower right, a symbol.
artifact.reverse_type: An eagle standing on a thunderbolt, in 3/4-view to the left, turning its head to the right.

artifact.name: Boston 1971.391
artifact.sources_used: H. Hamburger, <hi rend="ital">Publications of the Israel Numismatic Society</hi> 1 (1954) 75, no. 16
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Julia Domna, facing right. She wears a stephane over wavy hair, which is arranged in six horizontal ridges, and tied in a large bun at the back of her head.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, an eagle, with wings spread, stands slightly to the right with its head to the left. It holds a wreath in its beak and stands above a draped bust of Helios (Sun), facing left.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.240
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Antoninus Pius, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the nude figure of Herakles, leaning on club, in 3/4-view to the right. He holds his hand on his right hip.

artifact.name: Boston 64.503
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Galatia, Cappadocia, and Syria, 217, no. 542 (slight reverse die variation)
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Otacilia Severa, facing right. Her bust rises from a crescent and she wears a stephane (crown) over her wavy hair, which terminates in a braid brought up the back of her head.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands an eagle, in 3/4-view to the left, with its head turned profile to the right. It holds a wreath in its beak.

artifact.name: Boston 65.6
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Galatia, Cappadocia, and Syria, 146, no. 60; <bibl>Sear 1982, 397, no. 4144</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Philip II, draped and cuirassed, facing right.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the figure of Atergatis, wearing a turreted crown, and holding a scepter in her right hand, faces front, riding a lion to profile to the right.

artifact.name: Boston 1970.388
artifact.sources_used: A. Bellinger, <hi rend="ital">Syrian Tetradrachms of Caracalla and Macrinus</hi> (New York 1940) 21, no. 1, variable reverse legend
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Septimius Severus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the draped figure of the Tyche (Fortune) of Antioch, profile to the right on Mount Oropos (pile of rocks). She wears a turreted (mural) crown and holds ears of corn with a poppy, in her outstretched right hand. At her feet swims the river god, Orontes, in 3/4-view to the right, although he looks back to the left.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.428
artifact.sources_used: For general type, see <bibl>Mionnet 1806-1838</bibl> IV, no. 61
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded and wearing a radiate crown, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits a river god, on the ground, reclining to the left, with his right arm wrapped around a tree. He holds a branch in his left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 63.1501
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Pontus, Paphlagonia, Bithynia, Bosporus, 147, no. 55 for obverse
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: The laureate bust of Maximinus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right.
artifact.reverse_type: Perhaps Herakles and the Stymphalian birds. Herakles runs in 3/4-view to the left, with his head turned to the right. He holds a bow in his left hand and his lion skin, draped over his left arm. Two birds fly in the right field, and one lies at his feet.

artifact.name: Boston 1982.423
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Septimius Severus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right.
artifact.reverse_type: The helmeted giant, Kapaneus, runs near profile to the right, but looks back to the left, as he approaches a ladder. He holds a spear in his right hand and a shield on his left arm.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.15
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Elagabalus, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, two nude wrestlers

artifact.name: Boston 61.1126
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, stands the nude figure of an athlete, in a frontal pose, with his head turned profile to the right, crowning himself. He holds a palm upright in his left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 66.281
artifact.sources_used: <hi rend="ital">BMC</hi> Ionia, 276, no. 323, variable spacing of legend and form of letters; <bibl>Sear 1982, 93, no. 1006</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Trajan, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: At left stands the nude figure of Herakles, holding his club and lion skin in his left hand and a cup in his right hand, in 3/4-view to the left. He is being crowned by a female figure (probably a city goddess) draped in peplos over chiton, who stands at right, in 3/4-view to the left. She wears a sword at her hip, holds a scepter at a diagonal in her left hand, and reaches out to crown Herakles with the wreath, in her right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1972.12
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Septimius Severus, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, Hades rides in a quadriga of galloping horses in 3/4-view to the right. He turns back, to the left, toward Persephone, whom he holds with his right arm. He also holds a scepter in his left hand. Persephone's basket of flowers, overturned, lies on the ground beneath the feet of the horses.

artifact.name: Boston 63.1245
artifact.sources_used: H. von Fritze, <hi rend="ital">Die Münzen von Pergamon</hi> (Berlin 1910) 62, pl. V, no. 4 (Berlin); cf. <hi rend="ital">BMC</hi> Mysia, 147, no. 288 for legend
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Bust of Marcus Aurelius, laureate, draped, cuirassed, right.
artifact.reverse_type: Satyr seated left, balancing infant Dionysos on his foot. Staff below.

artifact.name: Boston 1983.8
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Aurelian, wearing a radiate crown and bearded, facing right. Below the bust is a globe.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, helmeted and draped Athena lunges to the left, but turns her head back to the right. She holds a shield on her right arm and a spear in her left hand. At right is a styrax shrub to which a bucket is attached. In the lower right field is a vase.

artifact.name: Boston 1977.608
artifact.sources_used: <hi rend="ital">Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum, Deutschland, Sammlung von Aulock</hi>, vol. 11, no. 4681
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Geta, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the emperor, Geta, on horseback, gallops profile to the right, over a fallen barbarian. A cape flutters behind him and he holds a spear in his upraised right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1972.1017
artifact.donor: Gift of Miss Mary B. Comstock
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Septimius Severus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: The god Mên, in Eastern dress, with a crescent across his shoulders, rides on horseback to the right.

artifact.name: Boston 1983.7
artifact.sources_used: A. Bellinger, <hi rend="ital">Troy, the Coins</hi> (Cincinnati 1961) no. T154 (in Vienna)
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Lucius Verus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the flight of Aeneas. Aeneas, in military dress, walks in 3/4-view to the right, with his father, Anchises, seated on his left shoulder. He looks back, to the left, to his son, Ascanius, whom he leads by the hand.

artifact.name: Boston 35.218
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bare bust of Hadrian, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*K*O*I*N*W*N</Foreign> (across field, left and right); <Foreign lang=Greek>*B*E*I*Q*U*N*I*A*S</Foreign> (below)
artifact.reverse_type: The facade of an octastyle temple with a four legged animal (the she wolf?), profile to the right, in the pediment

artifact.name: Boston 63.1242
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Mysia, no. 32 (Gordian III) for reverse type; F. Imhoof-Blümer, <hi rend="ital">Nymphen und Chariten</hi> (1908) 193, 520, var. (Munich); cf. <bibl>Waddington 1904, no. 805</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Plautilla, facing right. Her hair is arranged in the melon style, divided into seven ridges pulled severely back to a small bun at the back of her head.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stand three nymphs, probably Danaids, each dressed in a peplos. The figure in the center stands in a frontal pose, while the flanking figures turn towards her. Each nymph holds a jug in her right hand. The outer figures each place an arm on the shoulder of the central figure.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.5
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Elagabalus, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the emperor paying homage to Ephesian Artemis. At left, the cult figure of Artemis stands in her tetrastyle temple. At right, the togate emperor stands in 3/4-view to the left, holding a patera (offering dish) in his right hand and sacrificing over a lighted altar.

artifact.name: Boston 1983.3
artifact.sources_used: <hi rend="ital">Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum, Deutschland, Sammlung von Aulock</hi>, vol. 12, no. 5011
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a circle, the laureate bust of Severus Alexander, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle three nude athletes draw lots. The athlete in the center lunges in 3/4-view to the left, reaching his hand into a jar. Over his head is the prize (a crown?). The athletes on the sides turn away from him. Each is preceded by a palm branch.

artifact.name: Boston 1983.6
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.comparanda: <hi rend="ital">Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum, Deutschland, Sammlung von Aulock</hi>, vol. 15, no. 7040 for obverse
artifact.obverse_type: Within a circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, facing right. A countermark with an image of Victoria (Victory) appears in the lower left field.
artifact.reverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*A*G/*W*N</Foreign> (on the side of the throne); <Foreign lang=Greek>*S*E*O*U*H*R*E*I*A *F*I*L*A*D*E*L*F*E*I*A</Foreign> (around); <Foreign lang=Greek>*N*I*K*A*I*E*W*N</Foreign> (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the emperor, enthroned, 3/4-view to the left. He holds a prize crown in his right hand, and a jug sits on the ground in front of him.

artifact.name: Boston 1974.510
artifact.sources_used: <hi rend="ital">Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum, Deutschland, Sammlung von Aulock</hi>, vol. 15, no. 6031
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*A*U*T *K *G *I*O*U *O*U*H *M*A*C*I*M*E*I*N*O*S *S*E*B</Foreign> (around); <Foreign lang=Greek>*P *P</Foreign> (across field, left and right)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bust of Maximinus, wearing a radiate crown, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*T*A*R*S*O*U *T*H*S *M*H*T*R*O*P*O*L*E*W*S</Foreign>; <Foreign lang=Greek>*G</Foreign> (in left field); <Foreign lang=Greek>*A / *M / *K / *B</Foreign> (in right field)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the Eastern god, Sandan, stands profile to the left, on the back of a horned lion. In his left hand he holds a wreath, while he raises his right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.6
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Severus Alexander, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, busts of Helios (Sun) and Selene (Moon) facing each other. Helios, at left, wears a radiate crown; Selene, at right, is draped and wears a crescent at her shoulders.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.425
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Phrygia, 123, no. 35 for general type, with different magistrate; <bibl>Sear 1982, 357, no. 3722</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Gordian III, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the river god, Hermos, reclines to the left. He holds a reed in his right hand and a cornucopia on his left arm, and leans his left elbow on an overturned vase from which water flows.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.104
artifact.sources_used: F. Imhoof-Blümer, <hi rend="ital">Kleinasiatische Münzen</hi> II (Vienna 1902) 406, no. 27
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Severus Alexander, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a stepped platform supporting two round altars in front of two rectangular bases, each with styrax tree. At left, a column supports an eagle, standing profile right, holding a wreath in its beak. At right, on another column stands Nike (Victory), profile to the left, also holding a wreath, as well as a palm.

artifact.name: Boston 62.163
artifact.donor: In memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Valerian, wearing a radiate crown, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands nude Herakles, in a frontal pose, with his head turned to the right, in the Garden of the Hesperides. He holds a club in his right hand, and his bow and lion skin in his left hand. At right is an apple tree, around which a serpent is entwined, in front of the, the three draped Hesperides.

artifact.name: Boston 1973.611
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bare bust of Marcus Aurelius as Caesar, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle is the facade of a tetrastyle temple, within which stands a nude figure of Herakles, profile to the right. He holds a club in his right hand and a short spear in his left.

artifact.name: Boston 61.193
artifact.donor: In memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Gallienus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Hektor, armed and helmeted, rides to the left in a biga.

artifact.name: Boston 1972.14
artifact.sources_used: <hi rend="ital">BMC</hi> Ionia, 279, no. 346 (variable spelling of magistrate); <hi rend="ital">Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum, Deutschland, Sammlung von Aulock</hi>, vol. 17, no. 8002
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bare bust of Marcus Aurelius, facing left
artifact.reverse_type: While Alexander III (Alexander the Great) reclines to the left, resting against his shield, sleeping under a plane tree, in the background, to the left, stand two draped female figures, the Nemeseis (personifications of Retribution), talking with each other.

artifact.name: Boston 62.368
artifact.sources_used: <hi rend="ital">Beschreibung der Antiken Münzen</hi> I (Berlin 1888) 227-28, nos. 41, 42, variable
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Caracalla, wearing a radiate crown, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*P*U*Q*I*A</Foreign> (inscribed on the five balls); <Foreign lang=Greek>*K*O*I*N*O*N *Q*R*A*K*W*N *A*L*E*C*A*N *E*N</Foreign> (around); <Foreign lang=Greek>*F*I*L*I*P*P / *O*P*O</Foreign> (below)
artifact.reverse_type: An oblique view of an agonistic urn, containing five balls (lots), on a square table with lions' feet. Below the table stand a palm and an amphora.

artifact.name: Boston 1982.284
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped, helmeted, and armed figure of Athena, in 3/4-view to the right, watching Perseus cut off the head of the kneeling Gorgon, Medusa. Perseus, at center, nude except for a cape, lunges in 3/4-view to the right, and turns his head back to the left. He holds his weapon, a sword, in his right hand, and Medusa's head in his left. At right, Medusa, draped, kneels in 3/4-view to the right.

artifact.name: Boston 63.1505
artifact.sources_used: F. Imhoof-Blumer, <hi rend="ital">Kleinasiatische Münzen</hi> I (Vienna 1901) 213 no. 24 for obv.
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Gordian III, wearing a radiate crown, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within an ark or a chest with an opened lid sit a draped man and woman, in 3/4-view to the left. Two similar figures stand in front of the ark, in 3/4-view to the left. Above them flies a dove, to the right, carrying an olive branch. A second bird sits on lid of the chest.

artifact.name: Boston 1972.16
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Pontus, Paphlagonia, Bithynia, Bosporus, no. 3, with star in rev. field; see also <hi rend="ital">Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum, Deutschland, Sammlung von Aulock</hi>, vol. 1, no. 297: both with obverse heads to right
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Antinous, facing left
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands Antinous, in the guide of a herdsman or Hermes, advancing in 3/4-view to the left, turning his head back to the right. He holds a pedum in his left hand, and extends his right hand to a reed. An ox, shown in near profile to the left, appears behind him.

artifact.name: Boston 59.296
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Caracalla, bearded and wearing a radiate crown, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle rides Caracalla, on horseback, profile to the right. He carries a spear diagonally in his right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1975.358
artifact.sources_used: <hi rend="ital">Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum, Deutschland, Sammlung von Aulock</hi>, vol. 4, no. 1277
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right. He wears the aegis and holds a spear over his left shoulder.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle stands the emperor, in military costume, between two military standards. He stands in a frontal pose, with his head to the left, holding a spear in his left hand and, in his right, a patera above a low altar.

artifact.name: Boston 58.695
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left. He wears the aegis.
artifact.reverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*K*O*I*N*O*N *Q*R*A*K*W*N *A*L*E*C*A*N*D*R*I*A *E*N *F*I*L*I</Foreign> (around); <Foreign lang=Greek>*P*P*O*P*O</Foreign> (in exergue); <Foreign lang=Greek>*P*Y*Q*I*A</Foreign> (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the nude figure of Hercules, slightly to the left. He holds his club in his right hand and his lion skin in his left.

artifact.name: Boston 1971.136
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.comparanda: Théodore Mionnet, <hi rend="ital">Description de médailles antiques, greques et romaines</hi> III (Paris 1818-1837) 46, no. 101, var. rev. legend
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Zeus Boulaios, bearded, facing left. Drapery appears on his left shoulder.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle an assembly of city gods of Pergamon, Mytilene, and Ephesos. At left stands Asklepios of Pergamon, draped and bearded, with a snake around the staff in his right hand. At center sits the Tyche of Mytilene, facing. She wears a mural crown, holds a phiale in her right hand, a rudder in her left hand, and a cornucopia on her left arm. At right stands the facing multi-breasted statue of Artemis of Ephesos, with two scepters.

artifact.name: Boston 64.1451
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Elagabalus, cuirassed, facing right. He wears a cloak around his shoulders and the gorgoneion on his breastplate.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the emperor, in military costume, clasping hands with the figure of Apollo Tyrimnaios, nude except for a cloak that falls from his shoulders. Both stand in frontal poses, with their heads turned towards an agonistic urn at center that the emperor holds over a flaming altar. Apollo holds a double ax in his left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1971.45
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, cuirassed and draped, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a bird's-eye view of the forum at Laodiceia. Within stands the emperor, standing profile to the right on a podium, delivering a speech. Citizens appear around him, on each side and between columns in front.

artifact.name: Boston 58.13
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMC</hi></bibl> Mysia, 156, no. 326, pl. 31, 6; L. Forrer, <hi rend="ital">Weber Collection of Greek Coins</hi> III (London 1924) pl. 190, 5227
artifact.donor: In memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, cuirassed and draped, facing right. He wears the gorgoneion on his breastplate.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands Caracalla, in military dress, in 3/4-view to the left, saluting the Asklepian serpent, coiled around a tree. Between the two is a facing statue of Telesphoros, on a tall cylindrical base.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.218
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Caracalla, bearded, cuirassed and draped, facing left. He wears the aegis.
artifact.reverse_legend: <Foreign lang=Greek>*K*O*I*N*O*N *Q*R*A*K*W*N *A*L*E*C*A*N*D*R*I*A *E*N *F*I*L*I</Foreign> (around); <Foreign lang=Greek>*P*O*P*O</Foreign> (in exergue); <Foreign lang=Greek>*P*U*Q*I*A</Foreign> (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the nude figure of a discus thrower, in 3/4-view to the left. He holds a discus in his left hand and three balls in his outstretched right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1982.467
artifact.sources_used: See F. Imhoof-Blümer, <hi rend="ital">Lydische Stadtmünzen</hi> (Bologna 1978) 159, 30, for rev. (Severus Alexander)
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate busts of Elagabalus and Severus Alexander, draped and cuirassed, facing each other. Elagabalus wears a laurel wreath.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, stands the nude figure of Helios (Sun), in a facing quadriga, with the horses shown in profile to right and left. Helios, wearing a radiate crown, holds a laurel branch in his lowered right hand and a double ax in his left.

artifact.name: Boston 1982.283
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> III, no. 89, pl. 33.2; head right; <hi rend="ital">Collection R. Jameson</hi> III (Paris 1913-1924) 165, no. 442
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.commentary: This piece is a mirror comprised of two Imperial bronze coins
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bare bust of Antinous, facing left
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, Antinous dressed as a herdsman, advancing in 3/4-view to the left, toward a reed; a star in the upper left field.

artifact.name: Boston 58.702
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP CAESAR HADRIANVS AVG COS III P P (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a circle, the laureate bust of Hadrian, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Hadrian and a companion in military dress, on horseback, gallop in profile to the right. Each mounted figure holds a spear horizontally. At right walks a soldier, in 3/4-view to the right, carrying a shield.

artifact.name: Boston 65.59
artifact.sources_used: M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 28-29, fig. 1; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.6, no. 29, pl. 39, no. 8 (bronze)</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: The laureate bust of Hadrian, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: The half-draped Genius of the Roman people stands in 3/4-view to the left, holding a cornucopia on his left arm, and a patera in his right hand, over a flaming, garlanded altar

artifact.name: Boston 1984.581
artifact.sources_used: Paul Strack, <hi rend="ital">Untersuchungen zur römischen reichsprägung des zweiter jahrhunderts</hi> (Stuttgart 1931-37) 2.129, no. 450
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Hadrian, bearded, facing left
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the emperor, wearing a hunter's cloak, rides to the right on a rearing horse. With a spear in his upraised right hand, he aims to kill a lion, running in profile to the right.

artifact.name: Boston 1984.217
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.17, under no. 70 (this as Weber Collection of Greek Coins)</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: ANTONINVS AVG PIVS P P TR P XIX COS IIII (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Antoninus Pius, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the helmeted and cloaked figure of Mars, in 3/4-view to the right. He turns his head back to the left, as he reaches his right hand out to place a helmet on a trophy, at left. In his left hand Mars holds a spear and a shield.

artifact.name: Boston 58.964
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: M ANTONINVS AVG TR P XXIX (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Marcus Aurelius, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the facing figure of Apollo, on a high-backed throne, holding a lyre in his left hand and a plectrum in his right. His bow and arrow rest against the left side of the throne.

artifact.name: Boston 59.185
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped bust of Lucilla, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the nude figure of Cupid and the draped figure of Venus. Cupid, at left, stands in 3/4-view to the right, with his right hand raised. Venus stands slightly to the right, but looks back to the left, where she reaches toward Cupid, with her right hand. She also holds a scepter in her left hand. At right is a lighted altar.

artifact.name: Boston 37.1162
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: M COMMODVS ANTONINVS PIVS FELIX AVG BRIT (around)
artifact.obverse_type: The laureate bust of Commodus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Commodus, in military garb, stands in 3/4-view to the right, toward the draped figure of Africa (the personification of the province), who reclines to the left. He holds a parazonium and a reversed spear on an elephant-scalp helmet. Africa, caressing a lion with her right hand, holds two ears of wheat in her left hand. Between them stands winged, draped Victoria (Victory), in profile to the right, placing a shield on a trophy.

artifact.name: Boston 58.966
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: The laureate bust of Commodus, bearded, draped, and wearing a cuirass with scales, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: [P M TR P VIIII IMP VI COS] IIII P P (around); TEMPORVM FELICITAS (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Pomona (the personification of Fruit) seated in profile to the right, on a backed chair, holding corn ears and a poppy in her left hand. She raises her right hand to a grape vine, below which frolic two children in a tub, and a third at the feet of the goddess.

artifact.name: Boston 65.907
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.71, no. 174</bibl>; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3.356-57, no. 993</bibl>; M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 30-31, fig. 3
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: M COMMODVS ANTONINVS PIVS FELIX AVG BRIT (around)
artifact.obverse_type: The laureate bust of Commodus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left
artifact.reverse_type: The harbor at Ostia. In front of the lighthouse, at right, stands the emperor with another standing figure, facing a sacrificed bull in the foreground. At left is a large ship, under sail, with Serapis seated in the stern. Two smaller ships, one with standards, float in the center, while two more ships, one under sail, appear above.

artifact.name: Boston 66.882
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.64, no. 116</bibl>; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3.379, no. 2, where obverse is termed Marcia</bibl>; M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 31-32, fig. 5
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: L AELIVS AVRELIVS COMMODVS AVG PIVS FELIX (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bust of Commodus, wearing a radiate crown and bearded, overlaps that of Roma, helmeted and wearing a necklace. Both face right. A pelta (Amazonian shield) appears in the lower right field.
artifact.reverse_legend: P M TR P XVII IMP VIII COS VII P P (around)
artifact.reverse_type: The nude figure of Hercules, with his lion skin over his left arm, and his right hand on his hip, stands in 3/4-view to the right, toward the togate and veiled emperor, Commodus. Commodus sacrifices, presumably to Hercules, over a lighted cylindrical altar, in the center.

artifact.name: Boston 68.17
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.73, no. 2</bibl>; <bibl>Toynbee 1944, 104</bibl>; M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 33-34, fig. 6; W. M. Whitehall, <hi rend="ital">MFA Boston. A Centennial History</hi> (Cambridge 1970) 667; <bibl>Greek & Roman Portraits 1972, no. 66</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Clodius Albinus, bearded, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the draped figure of Fortuna (Fortune), in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a rudder in her left hand and a cornucopia in her left arm. A wheel sits on the left side of her throne.

artifact.name: Boston 35.1465
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3, Lucius Verus, 204, no. 345, 346</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.48, no. 30, pl. 75, no. 3</bibl>, but the SC in the exergue is unique, indicating a Senatorial Medallion
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: L AVREL VERVS AVG ARMENIACVS IMP II TR P V COS II (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Lucius Verus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the winged and draped figure of Victoria (Victory) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a palm in her right hand but turns her head back to the right, where she reaches her left hand out to a trophy that she has erected. A diminutive Armenian stands in 3/4-view to the left, next to the trophy, with his hands clasped in front. A second Armenian is seated on the ground, at the foot of the trophy, profile to the right, clasping his left knee.

artifact.name: Boston 64.695
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3, Lucius Verus, no. 308</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.47, no. 20, pl. 746</bibl> (cf. <bibl>Grueber 1874, pl. 25.3<bibl>); M. Comstock, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 66 (1968) 29-31, fig. 2
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: L VERVS AVG ARM PARTH MAX (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Lucius Verus, facing left. He wears a scaled cuirassed and a paludamentum appears on his right shoulder.
artifact.reverse_legend: TR P VIII IMP IIII COS III (around)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the facing figure of Jupiter (Conservator). He holds a thunderbolt in his right hand and a scepter in his left. He is bearded and nude, except for a mantle which he holds over the (diminutive) togate figures of Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus, who stand at his feet, each in 3/4-view to the left.

artifact.name: Boston 1973.550
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.commentary: Imperial bronze medallion; the rim is turned up slightly, which suggests that it might have been formerly framed.
artifact.obverse_legend: ANTONINVS AVG PIVS P P TR P COS IIII (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the bearded bust of Antoninus Pius, facing right.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the bearded, nude figure of Hercules, near profile to the right, in a rustic landscape. He holds his club in his lowered right hand and his bow in his left hand, and his lion skin is draped over his left arm. Behind him is a bare tree. At right (in front of him) is a pile of rocks on which stands a hind who nurses the infant Telephus. An eagle is perched, to the left, on a rock behind the animal.

artifact.name: Boston 1970.589
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.43, no. 2 (the three other known specimens), pl. 71, nos. 3, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">Coin World</hi>, May 5, 1971, 3 (ill.); <bibl>Romans and Barbarians, 82, no. C28 (ill.)</bibl>
artifact.donor: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Cornelius C. Vermeule III
artifact.obverse_legend: [IMP ANTONINVS] AVG COS III IMP VERVS AVG COS II (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate busts of Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus, draped and cuirassed, facing each other
artifact.reverse_type: Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus, both in military costume, stand facing each other, clasping hands, on which they support a draped, winged figure of Victoria (Victory). Below their hands is a prisoner, crouched in profile to the right. At left stand three soldiers and at right stand two more.

artifact.name: Boston 37.27
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.64, no. 117, 118 (both 40 mm, 118 has radiate head of Commodus)</bibl>; <bibl>Cohen 1880-1892, 3.380, nos. 3-4</bibl>
artifact.obverse_legend: L AELIVS AVRELIVS COMMODVS AVG PIVS FELIX (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the jugate busts of Commodus and Roma or Minerva (or Marcia in the guise of one of these goddesses), facing right. Commodus is laureate, draped, and cuirassed. Roma, helmeted, wears a cuirass with an aegis.
artifact.reverse_legend: P M TR P XVII IMP VIII COS VII P P (around)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle sits the draped figure of Pietas (Piety) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a scepter in her left hand and extends her right hand to a naked child, who stands in profile to the right, before her.

artifact.name: Boston 60.5
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Hadrian, facing left
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the half-draped figure of the genius of the Roman people, in 3/4-view to the left. He holds a cornucopia in his left hand and, in his right hand, a patera over a lighted and garlanded altar.

artifact.name: Boston 68.150
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within at least three concentric dotted circles, the draped bust of Lucilla, facing right. Her hair is waved and braided and tied in a bun at the nape of her neck.
artifact.reverse_legend: PIETAS (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Pietas standing, head right, holding patera and box. At left, flaming altar.

artifact.name: Boston 1993.66
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: FL IVL CONSTANS P F AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the diademed bust of Constans I, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: GAVDIVM POPVLI ROMANI (around); VOT / V / MVLT / X (within wreath); A Q (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, a laurel wreath circumscribing an inscription, in four lines

artifact.name: Boston 1980.210
artifact.sources_used: Herbert Grueber, <hi rend="ital">Roman Medallions in the British Museum</hi> (London 1874) 51, no. 1
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a circle, the draped bust of Otacilia Severa, facing left. She wears a stephane (crown) over her waved hair, arranged in at least seven ridges, which terminates in a long braid brought up the back of her head.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle sits the draped figure of Otacilia as Pudicitia (Modesty) seated in 3/4-view to the left. She draws her veil over her face with her right hand and holds a scepter at a diagonal in her left hand. In front of her are two children, standing in profile to the right, one of whom raises a hand to her. Behind her stands the draped figure of Felicitas (Felicity), with her legs crossed, leaning on Pudacitia's throne. She holds a cornucopia in her left arm and a caduceus in her right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 34.1382
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP C M Q TRAIANVS DECIVS AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Trajan Decius, wearing a radiate crown and a slight beard, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: FELICITAS SAECVLI (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle stands the draped figure of Felicitas (Felicity) in 3/-view to the left. She holds a caduceus in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm.

artifact.name: Boston 1972.865
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a circle, the draped and cuirassed busts of Saloninus, at left, and Gallienus, laureate, at right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle stand four figures in military dress, all facing toward the center. The central two figures are emperors, clasping hands on which they support a draped, winged figure of Victoria (Victory), standing on a globe and holding a wreath. Behind each emperor stands a soldier holding a military standard.

artifact.name: Boston 1991.5
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.115, no. 3</bibl>; pl. 118, no. 10; C.C. Vermeule and F.Z. Wolsky, <hi rend="ital">The Museum Year: 1990-91</hi> 26 (ill.)
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP C M ANN FLORIANVS P AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a circle, the laureate bust of Florianus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle stand the draped figures of three Monetae (Mints), each holding a scale in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm, with a pile of metal at her feet

artifact.name: Boston 1974.531
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2.134, no. 3, pl. 130, no. 2</bibl>; <bibl>Romans and Barbarians, 158, no. C120 (ill.)</bibl>; C. Vermeule, <hi rend="ital">Bulletin of the Museum of Fine Arts</hi> 73 (1975) 20 (ill.); <bibl>Knudsen 1988, 57, 83, 225, 291, fig. 22</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the diademed bust of Constantine the Great, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_legend: GLORIA SAECVLI VIRTVS CAESS (around); P R (in exergue)
artifact.reverse_type: Constantine II, in military costume, presents a phoenix on a globe to the half-draped emperor, Constantine the Great, seated in 3/4-view to the left, on a cuirass. Constantine II, standing to the right, holds a trophy over his left shoulder, while a panther is seated, to the right, at his feet. Constantine the Great holds a scepter in his left hand, while he receives the globe with her right.

artifact.name: Boston 60.151
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed bust of Magnentius, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle runs the draped and winged figure of Victoria (Victory) in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a wreath in her extended right hand and a palm in her left.

artifact.name: Boston 1972.1000
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.commentary: Imperial bronze medallion. The coin has been pierced in the middle and subsequently plugged. The reverse has been double struck.
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the draped and cuirassed half figure of Decentius, facing right. He holds a spear, at a diagonal, in his right hand, and a figure of Victoria (Victory), standing on a globe and presenting him a wreath, in his left hand.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the emperor, dressed in military costume, rides on horseback in profile to the right. In his right hand he holds a spear which he has struck a falling barbarian.

artifact.name: Boston 1970.569
artifact.sources_used: <bibl>Toynbee 1944, 164, pl. 29.2 (this example, as private collection, Rome)</bibl>; <bibl>Gnecchi 1912, 2, pl. 100, no. 9 (same obverse die)</bibl>
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: The draped bust of Julia Mamaea, facing left. She wears a stephane (crown) over her wavy hair that is bound at the nape of her neck.
artifact.reverse_type: The veiled and crowned figure of Julia Mamaea, in the guise of Pudicitia (Modesty), is seated on a throne in 3/4-view to the right, between the draped personifications, Felicitas (Felicity), at left, and Pietas (Piety), at right. Felicitas holds a short scepter diagonally in her right hand and rests her left hand on her hip. Julia reaches her left hand up to her veil. Pietas, also veiled, reaches her right arm toward Julia and holds a cornucopia in her left arm.

artifact.name: Boston 34.1381
artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a circle, the draped bust of Etruscilla, facing right, rising from a crescent. She wears a stephane (crown) and her hair is gathered at the back in a long braid brought up the back of her head
artifact.reverse_type: The veiled and draped figure of Pudicitia (Modesty), enthroned in 3/4-view to the left, with her feet on a low footstool. She holds her veil away from her face with her right hand and holds a scepter, at a diagonal, in her left hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1971.358
artifact.sources_used: <bibl><hi rend="ital">BMCRE</hi></bibl> V, 514, no. 101, variable spacing in reverse legend
artifact.donor: Gift of Miss Mary B. Comstock
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP CAES M OPEL SEV MACRINVS AVG (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Within a circle, the laureate bust of Macrinus, bearded and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle stands the veiled and draped figure of Fides (Faith), in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a military standard upright in each hand.

artifact.name: Boston 59.516
artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.commentary: Imperial silver medallion with traces of gilding
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Volusian, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing right
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle stand the draped figures of three Monetae (Mints), each holding a scale in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm, with a pile of metal at her feet

artifact.donor: Anonymous Gift in Memory of Zoë Wilbour
artifact.obverse_type: Within a dotted circle, the laureate bust of Probus, bearded, draped and cuirassed, facing left. On his left shoulder is the emperor's shield, from behind which his spear seems to emerge, toward the left. The shield is decorated with a scene of the emperor on horseback, riding to the left, preceded by the winged Victoria (Victory) and followed by a soldier.
artifact.reverse_type: Within a circle stand the draped figures of three Monetae (Mints), each holding a scale in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left arm, with a pile of metal at her feet

artifact.donor: Theodora Wilbour Fund in Memory of Zoë Wilbour

artifact.obverse_type: The draped and cuirassed bust of Valentinian II, facing right. He wears a diadem comprised of two strands of pearls around his head.

artifact.reverse_type: The emperor, in military costume, stands slightly to the right, with his head turned to the left. He rests his left hand on his shield, and holds a military standard in his right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1971.210

artifact.reverse_type: Within a dotted circle, Alemannia (the personification of the region [Germany]), kneels in profile to the left, at the base of a trophy. She wears a high-waisted, long-sleeved gown and supports her head (in a gesture of grief ?) with her right hand.

artifact.name: Boston 1971.637

artifact.name: Boston 1971.213

artifact.reverse_type: The emperor, in military costume, stands slightly to the right, with his head turned to the left. He holds a globe in his left hand and raises his right hand above a star, in the left field. His head is encircled by a nimbus.

artifact.donor: Bequest of Miss Rebecca Salisbury
artifact.obverse_legend: [IMP CAES] NERVAE TRAIANO AVG GER DAC P M TR P [COS V P P] (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Bust of laureate Trajan, facing right, with drapery on his left shoulder
artifact.reverse_legend: [AL]IM ITAL (around); S C (left and right in field)
artifact.reverse_type: The draped figure of Annona (personification of the yearly bounty), stands in 3/4-view to the left. Her right knee is slightly bent, and she holds out two ears of grain in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left. At left, a togate boy stands front, with his head turned to the right towards Annona. He holds a scroll in his left hand and rests his right hand at his side.

artifact.name: Boston 92.56
artifact.donor: Bequest of Miss Rebecca Salisbury
artifact.obverse_legend: [IMP CAES NERV]AE TR[AIANO AVG GER DAC] P M TR P [COS V P P] (around)

artifact.reverse_legend: S P Q R OPTIM[O PRINCI]PI; S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Fortuna (personified Fortune), draped, stands in 3/4-view to the left. She holds a rudder in front of a prow in her right hand and a cornucopia in her left.

artifact.name: Boston 92.77
artifact.donor: Bequest of Miss Rebecca Salisbury
artifact.obverse_legend: IMP CAES NERVAE TRAIANO AVG GER DAC P M TR [P COS] V P P (around)
artifact.obverse_type: Laureate bust of Trajan, facing right. He wears the aegis on his left shoulder.
artifact.reverse_legend: S P Q R OPTIMO PRINCIPI (around); S C (across field, left and right)
artifact.reverse_type: Helmeted Roma, in military dress, stands in 3/4-view to the left. She holds Victoria (Victory) in her extended right hand and a vertical spear, reversed, in her left. In front of her is a small Dacian captive, wearing cloak and breeches, kneeling to the right, and stretching out his arms to Roma.

They hold reeds and lean on urns as they look up towards Trajan. Between them , a personification of Armenia, wearing a pointed cap, sits facing to the left and up towards Trajan.

Her left hand is raised to his right arm.

In the center of the temple, a figure is seated on high base. In the pediment, there is a seated figure between two reclining figures. On the roof there are three figures, on each corner stands a winged Victory holding a trophy, and at the peak of the roof stands a figure holding a spear.
